      • getCurrentLevel

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
public static java.lang.Integer getCurrentLevel()
        Returns:
        Usually the same as getRemainingCapacity(), but could be energy or charge units

      • getCurrentPercent

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
public static java.lang.Double getCurrentPercent()
        Returns:
        Same as getRemainingCapacity(), but possibly (not often) higher precision

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable

        Warning: usually garbage
        Returns:
        remaining power in milli-watt-hours

      • getRemainingPower

        public static double getRemainingPower()
        Warning: garbage if either getRemainingEnergy() or getRemainingTime() is garbage, i.e. most likely garbage
        Returns:
        average continuous milli-watts of power remaining

      • getRemainingTime

        public static double getRemainingTime()
        Warning: garbage if getAverageCurrent() is garbage
        Returns:
        hours remaining

      • getScale

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
public static java.lang.Integer getScale()
        Returns:
        Maximal value of getCurrentLevel(), usually 100 as in percent, but could be energy or charge or something..

      • getString

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getString()
        Returns:
        Status string of current battery conditions

      • getTechnology

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getTechnology()
        Warning: most devices don't have this
        Returns:
        Likely a null string, otherwise it's text describing the technology (e.g. Li-ion)

 @NonNull
